title: An Enhancement of Jiang, Z., et al.'s Compression-Based Classification Algorithm Applied to News Article Categorization
author: Sean Lester C. Benavides (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila), Cid Antonio F. Masapol (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila), Jonathan C. Morano (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila), Dan Michael A. Cortez (Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila)
background: The study enhances a compression-based classification algorithm to more efficiently categorize news articles by detecting similarities through unigram extraction.
contribution: This paper introduces an enhanced unigram extraction and concatenation method to solve issues with existing compression algorithms, achieving improved classification accuracy by an average of 5.73%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods rely on complete document compression, which struggles with sliding window limitations and redundant data.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by focusing on unigram extraction and using the union of unigrams for similarity detection before compression, thus reducing redundancy.

key_innovation: Focuses on compacting individual words rather than entire documents, which enhances accuracy in measuring semantic similarity.
real_world_impact: This approach may help enhance text classification systems in resource-constrained environments, potentially improving news article categorization efficiency and accuracy.
limitations: The study's evaluation may not reflect complexities found in real-world news categorization due to its controlled testing conditions.

new_terms.unigram: **Unigram** refers to a single element extracted from text, used here to streamline the analysis and classification process.
new_terms.Normalized Compression Distance (NCD): **Normalized Compression Distance (NCD)** is a metric used to measure similarity between documents based on the efficiency of their compression.
